title: Help recovering lost cookies and container data after accidental downgrade on Firefox
content:
Hello Firefox Support,

I’m reaching out for assistance regarding a serious data loss issue I experienced.

Recently, I accidentally launched an older version of Firefox on macOS using my existing profile. After this, I noticed that all my Multi-Account Containers were still listed, but all cookies associated with those containers were completely lost. I understand this might be caused by incompatibility between Firefox versions and profile structures.

I have located files such as: - `cookies.sqlite` - `containers.json` - `sessionstore-backups/upgrade.jsonlz4-*`

However, none of the cookies appear to have `originAttributes` associated with containers anymore (only empty strings). Is there any way to recover or reassign the lost cookies to their original containers?

This incident has affected multiple work logins and multi-account configurations I heavily depend on.

Thank you for any support or tools you can provide to assist in restoring the lost data.

Best regards, Thang
creator: lush3ng

title: Firefox doesn't display certain fonts
content:
Hi, for some reason Firefox doesn't display a lot of fonts for me.

Here's a list of the fonts, that I've found that aren't being displayed: serif xx-large, serif, fantasy, helvetica, Andale Mono, Vera Serif, Vera Sans, Vera Sans

Chrome, Edge and (because why not) Internet explorer all seem to render these just fine

Any help is very much appreciated!

I'm on Firefox 138.0.4; Windows 10

Edit: Turns out, I was sort of the issue.

My main issue was with Sites using Helvetica, as I found the readability of those sites to be atrocious. As it turns out, Firefox was the only one of my browsers actually using Helvetica (I do have Helvetica installed). Sites that have Helvetica first in their font-families would actually be displayed using Helvetica.

I changed "layout.css.font-visibility" to 2 and now those sites just use Arial

So the conclusion is, that I actually just hate Helvetica...

title: How can I configure Firefox to send screenshots directly to an AI-based web tool?
content:
I’ve been using Firefox’s built-in screenshot feature to grab images of a browser-based puzzle game I play, and I’d love to streamline the process of sending those screenshots to an external AI solver. Specifically, I use a free online tool called Block Blast Solver Block Blast Solver that analyzes a game screenshot and instantly shows you the optimal move in 3D with color coding.

Right now I’m manually saving each screenshot and then uploading it on the solver’s site. Is there a way in Firefox perhaps via about\:config tweaks, a bookmarklet, or a lightweight extension—to automatically forward or “share” the clipboard image straight to a web service URL?

Things I’m curious about:

Can I modify the default screenshot “Save” action to POST the image to an external endpoint? Are there recommended bookmarklet patterns for sending the last screenshot directly to a URL with minimal clicks? Does Firefox support any native “share to web” workflow that could be repurposed for a custom site like this?

Any pointers on how to wire up Firefox’s screenshot workflow to a third-party AI tool (e.g. Block Blast Solver AI) would be hugely appreciated!

title: How could I merge and organize two similar files for bookmarks?
content:
I'm in a messy situation right now

  1. I have two Windows installs with two separate installations of Firefox
  2. They are both different versions, one is the latest version and one is an extended support release: "115.23.1esr". I don't think that would really matter, just in case


Let's start. At the time, both installs with my bookmarks were the exact same

On one of my installs of Windows, I organized my bookmarks. I also put existing folders in new folders

And I thought that Firefox would synchronize my bookmarks with my other install. But it didn't happen.... at all! My bookmarks were the exact same as before... and still are!


  1. One install is organized but not completely up to date
  2. The other isn't organized and I've added a couple new bookmarks to it over time because of this stupid situation

What can I do here? And can I prevent this from happening in the future?

I can't depend on my bookmarks if it's not going to sync at all. It could be a malfunction on my end but I don't know at this point

'Wrote this question from my second install with the 115.23.1esr version'

title: Mac OS desktop Firefox slow or stops working entirely
content:
For days I have been seeing Firefox be very slow to load a page (as in minutes) or stop working entirely. At the same time Chrome works fine. Mac Mail has become intermittent as well. I have uninstalled Norton products and changed Network proxy settings many times. Nothing helps. I have created new profiles. I switch between profiles. I have hacked into my WiFi router. Nothing, nothing helps. Safari hangs up too. Firefox on my android phone continues to work properly when using my Wifi router -the same router my Mac Studio connects to the internet with. I can access my third party mail service via Firefox on my android phone. Both FireTV devices work. I am at my wit's end. At this point I have shifted all of my work over to Chrome.

I have cleared caches. I have gotten rid of all cookies. I have restarted Firefox and rebooted my computer countless times.

Mac OS Sequoia 15.5 Firefox 138.04
